nodes.text: So what's up with you tonight?

nodes.message: Needs to be rewritten if the Drat Invasion is over

nodes.text: Hello. I'm just reading about the castle.
It's interesting how there were no Drats in the Library during the invasion.
I don't think it has anything to do with the room. I think that the Drats were afraid of the Librarian. They didn't want to face his disapproval.
Hello. I was just looking into ways to deal with the Drat invasion.
It's interesting how there are no Drats in the Library.
I think that the Drats are afraid of the Librarian. They don't want to face his disapproval.

nodes.message: Thomas does not know about secret passage or Creepy man

nodes.text: I know who is behind the Drat invasion - a Queen Drat.
So there is a secret passageway here in the library? It must be behind the portrait of the dark wizard. I've never liked that painting. There's something very disturbing about it.
There is no plaque for the painting and the Librarian won't talk about it. I've always thought that was very odd.
Do you think you can stop the Drat invasion by reading a book?
No. I was just looking at the layout of the castle and trying to figure out from where the Drats are coming. It's not the Sea Caves or the Catacombs.

nodes.commentor: Shawn Told Thomas about the QD

nodes.message: Thomas knows about secret passage in library, Creepy man

nodes.text: Have you found out anything useful about the Queen Drat?

There's no mention of a Queen Drat or Warrior Drat invasions in any of the books I've found here. However, I did find an old manuscript talking about a torture chamber and a concealed stairway down to the dungeon.
The handwriting on the manuscript was terrible... the one who wrote it must have been ill at the time. I couldn't make out most of the writing.
However, there was a very strange phrase on the frontispiece of the pages. It was clearly important.

"Do not linger long on your path. 
Duty will call you to cross an ocean of doubt, Valor will be your shield when the flames close in about you, and Honor will give you direction through the winds of Chaos. 
Remember that and you will find your way."
The Librarian said something strange to me about opening up some inaccessible ways and some sort of avoidance rune. Did he say anything about them to you?
Yes, and the Librarian usually doesn't give away much information. I think he wants us to deal with the problem.
I looked up Avoidance Runes - they cause people to stay away from the area around the rune by making them feel uncomfortable.
So the Avoidance Rune makes us want to rune away from it? Does that mean we need to go somewhere we don't feel like going to in order to stop the Drat Invasion?
Yes, that's more or less correct.
With all these Warrior Drats running around, at least we don't have to worry about Terk patrolling the halls. I bet he's quaking in his office.
The Warrior Drats are very dangerous. Fortunately, the Warrior and the Paladin students are keeping the main areas clear.
Have you read anything else that might be useful in stopping the Drats?
I found a torn page of a book underneath a shelf in the history section. It said something about how the dungeon of this castle concealed a great Evil. There was a mention of betrayal and traps.
What's that got to do with the Drats?
I'm not really sure it means anything, but I would be extra careful exploring the dungeon in search of Drats.
There was also some mention of a 'Guardian' down in the dungeon. I'm not sure whether it can be avoided or not.
You know that I'd still like to spend a little quality time with you.
I'd enjoy being with you more, too. Perhaps later tonight?
Sure, later tonight after curfew in Darla's Den. I'll look forward to seeing you there.
I'll see you there.

nodes.name: Late Date with Thomas
nodes.description: I'm meeting Thomas in the den after hours, just the two of us and as many Warrior Drats that decide to invade the room.

nodes.text: Maybe sometime soon when we're both not trying to save the school from dire disaster.
I'm sorry, Shawn. I appreciate your kindness, but no.
See you later!
I'll be up in Darla's Den after curfew. Just so you know...
Good night.
